Welcome to **[MATH3085/6143: Survival Models]{.attention}**! **MATH3085/6143** introduces the fundamental concepts and key issues in lifetime and time-to-event data analysis, with applications in areas such as actuarial practice, medical sciences, and demography. 

Note that **MATH3085** and **MATH6143** are double-badged. This means that the course content of the two modules is the same but some of the assessment differs.

### :pencil: **Assessment**

The basic module assessment breakdown is

1. 30% [data analysis project](project.html)
2. 70% written exam

The [data analysis project](project.html) involves a series of tasks in which you will conduct survival analysis on provided datasets using `R`. The project will be released around mid-December 2025, and detailed instructions and guidance will be provided towards the end of the term.

### :book: **Lecture Notes**  

Lecture notes are available in two formats:

1. <a href="/lecture_notes/skeleton.pdf" download>Skeleton notes</a>: containing omissions corresponding to mathematical details.
2. <a href="/lecture_notes/complete.pdf" download>Complete notes</a>: in which the previously omitted parts are included and highlighted in blue.

### :ledger: **Syllabus**

The module content is structured into 16 chapters (with the corresponding slides updated throughout the term)

1.  [Introduction](/slides/_output/chap_1.html)
2.  [Statistical Models](/slides/_output/chap_2.html)
3.  [The Survival Distribution](/slides/_output/chap_3.html)
4.  [Distributions for Survival Models](/slides/_output/chap_4.html)
5.  Survival models: parameter estimation <!--(/slides/_output/chap_5.html)-->
6.  Non-parametric Survival Estimation <!--(/slides/_output/chap_6.html)-->
7.  Survival Regression Models <!--(/slides/_output/chap_7.html)-->
8.  Multistate Survival Models <!--(/slides/_output/chap_8.html)-->
9.  Inference for Multistate Models <!--(/slides/_output/chap_9.html)-->
10. Modelling Human Lifetime
11. The Life Table and Life Expectancy
12. Interpolating a Life Table
13. Life Table Models
14. Exposure to Risk
15. Comparing Mortality Rates
16. Graduation

These chapters can be divided into six parts (labelled A to F), each corresponding to a [problem sheet](/problem_sheets.html). The table below shows which chapters are included in each part.

:::{.small-text}
| Part | Chapters | Problem sheet |
|------|----------|---------------|
| A    | 1-4      | 1             |
| B    | 5-6      | 2             |
| C    | 7        | 3             |
| D    | 8-9      | 4             |
| E    | 10-13    | 5             |
| F    | 14-16    | 6             |
:::
